long_desc.thetext:
The reordering is broken. At least in Firefox 3. It seems to start correctly, but the sequence is not stoppable correctly afterwards.
Example on the right: application/demobrowser/source/index.html#ui~DragDrop.html

I could only verify that it doesn't always work reliably in FF3/Windows. Not sure, Sebastian, what you mean by "sequence is not stoppable"?
@Alex, please also have a look.

The sequence of drag&drop was never stopped e.g. the cursor was still the old one and the reaction on the dragging never stopped - even after mouseup on the button.
Somehow this seems to be fixed now as it is not reproducable for me in Firefox and Safari anymore. Maybe this was a temporary issue in trunk only.

I noticed at least the following: While dragging it is possible to place the mouse pointer exactly over the 1px drop indicator. This leads a non-droppable cursor and the drop is ignored (as expected?).
It would probably be best to enhance the example code in such a way, that the drop is handled correctly even when targeting the indicator.
@Andreas: Though that has nothing to do with the original issue why this bug was reported. I would suggest to close this bug as INVALID or WORKSFORME for the moment as it is not reproducable anymore.

Alex and I found out about the issue with the indicator, so we added an appropriate description. It's ok to fix this issue within the existing bug report, I expect it to be resolved soon and the bug then to be closed.
Closed all bugs already shipped with a release.
